standard_metadata.standard_description: Fluently divide multi-digit numbers using the standard algorithm.

question.content: **$\Large{9393 \div 76 = ?}$**    *Write your answer as a whole number and remainder.*   $\text{ R }$

hints.content: $\begin{array}{rr} &\phantom{000}&\\ {76}&\overline{\Big)\blue{93}93} \end{array}$  $76$ is larger than $9$, so let's look at $93$ instead.  How many times does $76$ go into $\blue{93}$?

$\begin{array}{rr} &1\phantom{00}&\\ {76}&\overline{\Big)9393}\\ &\mathllap{-}\underline{76}{\downarrow}\phantom{0}\\ &\blue{179}\phantom{0} \end{array}$  How many times does $76$ go into $\blue{179}$?

$\begin{array}{rr} &12\phantom{0}&\\ {76}&\overline{\Big)9393}\\ &\mathllap{-}\underline{76}\phantom{0}{\downarrow}\\ &179{\downarrow}\\ &\mathllap{-}\underline{152}{\downarrow}\\ &\blue{273} \end{array}$  How many times does $76$ go into $\blue{273}$?

$\begin{array}{rr} &123&\text{R}45\\ {76}&\overline{\Big)9393}\\ &\mathllap{-}\underline{76}\phantom{00}\\ &179\phantom{0}\\ &\mathllap{-}\underline{152}\phantom{0}\\ &273\\ &\mathllap{-}\underline{228}\\ &45 \end{array}$  There are no more digits to bring down. Since $45$ is less than $76$, it is left as our remainder.

question.content: **$\Large{8456 \div 22 = ?}$**    *Write your answer as a whole number and remainder.*   $\text{ R }$

hints.content: $\begin{array}{rr} &\phantom{000}&\\ {22}&\overline{\Big)\blue{84}56} \end{array}$  $22$ is larger than $8$, so let's look at $84$ instead.  How many times does $22$ go into $\blue{84}$?

$\begin{array}{rr} &3\phantom{00}&\\ {22}&\overline{\Big)8456}\\ &\mathllap{-}\underline{66}{\downarrow}\phantom{0}\\ &\blue{185}\phantom{0} \end{array}$  How many times does $22$ go into $\blue{185}$?

$\begin{array}{rr} &38\phantom{0}&\\ {22}&\overline{\Big)8456}\\ &\mathllap{-}\underline{66}\phantom{0}{\downarrow}\\ &185{\downarrow}\\ &\mathllap{-}\underline{176}{\downarrow}\\ &\blue{96} \end{array}$  How many times does $22$ go into $\blue{96}$?

$\begin{array}{rr} &384&\text{R}8\\ {22}&\overline{\Big)8456}\\ &\mathllap{-}\underline{66}\phantom{00}\\ &185\phantom{0}\\ &\mathllap{-}\underline{176}\phantom{0}\\ &96\\ &\mathllap{-}\underline{88}\\ &8 \end{array}$  There are no more digits to bring down. Since $8$ is less than $22$, it is left as our remainder.
